Package com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment2

Class CharacterGame

java.lang.Object
com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment2.CharacterGame
public class CharacterGame
extends java.lang.Object
This class is the core of the program, it allocates characters into an array on start up then interacts with a user who can select characters (by array index) to run a combat simulation. The code of CharacterGame class is provided by the professor
Version:
Java 1.8.0
Author:
Simon Ao
Student ID:040983402
Section:CST8284-312
Update:2021-3-17

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    CharacterGame()
    Initializes the array of character references with a new character for each element within the characters array.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void runGame()
    This is the core logic of the program, it displays the characters available asks the user to enter two index values calls method fight to process the combat match heals all of the characters to full health after the combat prompts the user if they want to run another fight-match (Y/N)

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • CharacterGame

      public CharacterGame()
      Initializes the array of character references with a new character for each element within the characters array.

  • Method Details

    • runGame

      public void runGame()
      This is the core logic of the program, it
      • displays the characters available
      • asks the user to enter two index values
      • calls method fight to process the combat match
      • heals all of the characters to full health after the combat
      • prompts the user if they want to run another fight-match (Y/N)
